sentences.en: A botanist can differentiate varieties of plants.
sentences.cn: 植物学家能区分各种不同的植物.

sentences.en: A child may not differentiate between his imagination and the real world.
sentences.cn: 儿童可能无法将自己的幻想与真实世界区分开来。

sentences.en: At this age your baby cannot differentiate one person from another.
sentences.cn: 这个年龄的婴儿还不能认人。
要把命令和设置区别开来.

sentences.en: He cannot differentiate the two flowers.
He couldn't differentiate between the enemy and ourselves.
He never learned to differentiate between good and evil.
It is wrong to differentiate between pupils according to their family background.
sentences.cn: 按家庭出身区别对待学生的做法是错误的.

sentences.en: It's difficult to differentiate between the two varieties.
It's wrong to differentiate between boys and girls.
sentences.cn: 男女孩区别对待是错误的.

sentences.en: Skin cells just in front of them differentiate to form lenses.
sentences.cn: 它们前面的皮肤细胞就分化而形成晶体.

sentences.en: They are sometimes difficult to differentiate from aromatic or olefinic absorptions.
sentences.cn: 有时它们就难于和芳香族或烯烃的吸收峰相互区别.

sentences.en: This genus of plants differentiate into many species.
sentences.cn: 这种植物可区分为许多种类.

sentences.en: This property, often called " helicity,'serves to differentiate the neutrino from its antiparticle.
sentences.cn: 这种性质通常称为 “ 螺旋性”, 可以用来区分中微子和它的反粒子.

sentences.en: What differentiates these two periods of history?
sentences.cn: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

sentences.en: You can differentiate between the houses by the shape of their chimneys.
sentences.cn: 你可以凭借烟囱形状的不同来区分这两幢房子.

words.tran_cn: [数] 可微的；可辨的；可区分的
分化型；已分化的；可区分的
变异，[生物] 分化；区别
[自] 微分器；微分电路；区分者

trans.tran_en: to recognize or express the difference between things or people
to recognize or express the difference between things or people

trans.tran_cn: 区分； 使不同， 使有差异
trans.tran_en: If you differentiate between things or if you differentiate one thing from another, you recognize or show the difference between them
